snippet: Two former executives of the Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty were charged with grand larceny, money laundering, conspiracy and filing false documents.
abstract: David Cohen and Herbert Friedman, former executives of Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty, are charged with grand larceny, money laundering, conspiracy and filing false documents; accusations first drew attention when Met Council's board fired its executive director, William E Rapfogel, because it believed he was taking kickbacks from its insurance broker.
lead_paragraph: Two former executives of the Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty were charged with grand larceny, money laundering, conspiracy and filing false documents.

headline.main: More Charges in Scheme to Defraud a Charity
headline.print_headline: More Charges In Scheme To Defraud A Charity
